item.title: Configuring Wi-Fi on Ubuntu Server 64-bit on Raspberry Pi 4
item.description: After discovering that by default Raspberry installs 32-bit Raspbian OS, I wanted to reinstall it with a 64 bit - this would allow to run Kubernetes on Raspberry Decided to go with Ubuntu Server 64. Installed it on SD Card with Raspberry Pi Imager. After boot found out that need to connect it to WI-FI. Configuring wpa_supplicant didn’t help, still had issues with not getting IP Address from DHCP. Finally, did the following:
